Facebook sued by investors

Facebook's IPO is getting less friendly by the day with investors and regulators raising new concerns after two days of falling share prices. (Bloomberg, 10:44 a.m.)

Harvard alumni directory includes Unabomber

Harvard's class of 1962 directory includes Ted Kaczynski, the graduate who went on to send deadly bombs through the mail. (Globe, 12:02 p.m.)

Everett crossing guard hit by truck

The crossing guard was injured after being struck by an MWRA truck this morning near the George Keverian Elementary School, police said. (Globe, 12:48 p.m.)

Romney features laid-off workers in ad

Mitt Romney gave President Obama a taste of his own medicine with an ad featuring struggling Americans who pin their woes on broken promises. (Globe, 12:05 p.m.)

Martha Coakley won't address
Mass. Democratic Convention

The Massachusetts Democratic Party list of speakers for its nominating convention includes Governor Patrick and US Senate hopeful Elizabeth Warren. (AP, 12:38 p.m.)

Nevada wildfire spreads

A fast-moving wildfire erupted in a rural neighborhood near the Nevada-California line and destroyed two homes but no injuries have been reported and the danger from what one resident called a "wall of fire" was subsiding.
